title: 105_hr1468
content: Section 1 amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act to provide a Medicaid exception for permanent resident alien children under 19 years of age. Section 2 extends the eligibility period for SSI and Medicaid for refugees and asylees from 5 to 7 years. Section 3 of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act amends SSI eligibility for qualified aliens who became blind or disabled after admission, extending the eligibility period from 5 to 7 years. Eligibility for benefits under the supplemental security income program is extended to qualified aliens who became blind or disabled after admission to the United States. The eligibility for supplemental security income benefits is extended to blind or disabled aliens who became so after entering the United States, without any reimbursement requirement. SSI eligibility is extended to qualified aliens who were admitted to the United States before turning 18 and were blind or disabled prior to admission. Eligibility for SSI benefits is expanded to qualified aliens who became blind or disabled after admission to the United States before turning 18. The Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to include a special rule for SSI benefits for blind and disabled aliens. This rule exempts certain aliens from the benefits under the supplemental security income program. Additionally, there is no reimbursement requirement for benefits under section 402(a)(3)(A). Benefits under section 402(a)(3)(A) for blind or disabled aliens admitted to the US before age 18 or becoming blind/disabled after admission. SEC. 5 amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to provide exceptions for blind and disabled aliens regarding federal means-tested public benefits. SEC. 6 addresses SSI eligibility for permanent resident aliens aged 76 and above. SEC. 6 amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to exempt permanent resident aliens aged 76 and above from certain eligibility requirements for supplemental security income benefits. Amendment exempts permanent resident aliens aged 76 and above from eligibility requirements for supplemental security income benefits. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if included in the enactment of title IV of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996, with exceptions for benefits payable after July 1997.
